alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Sitka (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 12:28AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, around Sitka along the Eastern Gulf Coast. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Possible isolated landslides in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1223 AM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding, especially near Indian River along with other small streams in the area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - For Indian River at Sitka: At 12 am the stage was 23.3 feet. Flood Stage is 25.5 feet. Forecast: The river crested around 24.9 ft around 5 pm monday. It is currently below bankfull stage and falling, but additional rises could still be seen through Tue morning. Impacts: At 25.5 feet: Water will begin to flood the National Park Service`s bridge near Sawmill Creek road along with the trail system in the park near the river. Other places in the Sitka area will also begin to see minor flooding issues. - All residents on or near mountain slopes should be prepared for possible landslides.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
